373 - 22 Dec 2023 03:51PM - Aditi Edoofa: I am ____________, a student selected for the prestigious Edoofa Scholarship Program to pursue my tertiary education in India. I have always dreamed of studying abroad, especially after the recent fee hikes at universities in Zimbabwe, where tuition fees range from ZWL 650,000 to ZWL 750,000 per term. When considering the yearly cost, including food and accommodation, it exceeds $2,100 in our beloved Zimbabwe.  Today, the internet is a necessity, and I truly realized its importance when preparing for my journey to India. We are all well aware of the expenses we have to bear just to access subpar internet services. During my school days, I used to spend a minimum of $35-$40 a month to ensure I had sufficient internet, which added up to around $450-$500 annually. It's remarkable to discover that in India, students value their educational infrastructure so much that they can access a necessity like the internet for around $40 for the entire year.  Conversely, when speaking to my seniors in Zimbabwe, I realized that I might have to compromise on my choice of course due to limited available seats. Furthermore, many seniors are struggling with unemployment after graduating in Zimbabwe.  I had a strong desire to support my family through part-time employment during my course, and that's when I learned about the Earn While You Learn Program at EDOOFA, which offers opportunities to earn between $50 and $100 per month throughout the course.  While pursuing tertiary education in India is more affordable than universities in Zimbabwe, it comes with its own challenges. I diligently followed the 5'S, which played a crucial role in helping me qualify for this scholarship. I urge you to go through these Five Pointers with utmost sincerity. The counselors will ask you questions based on the information in the flyer I have attached  Fill out the Offline Form of EDOOFA after completing the 5‚ÄôS of Edoofa. Best of Luck!

375 - 22 Dec 2023 03:51PM - Aditi Edoofa: Along with this share the following information ABOUT Edoofa with them:  Let me introduce you to the scholarship program that is providing me an opportunity to fulfill all my dreams related to higher education - EDOOFA -Education For All.
376 - 22 Dec 2023 03:51PM - Aditi Edoofa: To give you an insight about Edoofa, it is a scholarship program initiated by *Anhad Edutrain Solutions Pvt. Ltd., INDIA*. Edoofa believes quality education should be accessible to all and not just the privilege of a few. Through our scholarship program that is based on a work-study model, Edoofa solves both problems, that of *lack of affordability and of employability in higher education.* Edoofa stays with the students throughout their academic life as mentor and caretaker, right from building the application, applying to colleges, training, and making them job-ready. This is an experience that I acknowledge as being a Proud Edoofian!üéâ

The company must be financially stable and sound d) Background of founder. The founder must have a strong background in terms of qualifications and experience. I've  also understood that platforms like Linkedln and google can be used to connect to these companies as well as social media platforms like facebook and instagram. A few steps have been outlined in the process to look for the right companies. These include 1) Searching which is by connecting with founders and start-ups on linkedln and on google 2) studying the nature of the company, its functions, purposes and expertise 3) Studying the website of the company to check if it is working properly 4) Checking the various social media platforms of the company to get an idea of the activities and functioning status of the company 5) To understand the background of the founder and other core members 6) Reaching out the company members and dropping connections requests. 140 - 22 Dec 2023 10:16AM - +263 71 249 4868: 2. Explain about BPM ( Business Process Management ) Life Cycle. Business Process Management is an approach focused on aligning all aspects of an organization with the wants and needs of a client.  It consists of five stages which are designing, modeling, executing, monitoring and optimizing. I'm going to describe the stages fully below.  Designing encompasses  the identification of existing processes and the design of to-be processes. Good design reduces the number of problems. The aim of this step is to ensure that a correct efficient theoretical design is prepared.  Furthermore, modeling takes the theoretical design and introduces combinations of variables.  The execution stage is one of the ways to automate processes thereby  purchasing an application that executes the required steps of the process. To eliminate problems at the execution stage software to be developed should enables the full business process to be defined in a computer language.  Moreover, the monitoring phase is where  performance is measured. Monitoring encompasses the tracking of individual processes and statistics on the performance of one or more process can be provided.  On the optimization stage, the retrieving process, identifying the potential opportunities for cost savings and applying those enhancements in the design of the process is done.  Conclusively, the five stages creates greater business value.

Business brings in new technology as machinery or labor incentives methods from a foreign nation brings technological development.  Thus the advanced productivity increases the income of a region and are directly impacted when new businesses exports goods and services to neighboring countries. 178 - 21 Dec 2023 06:09PM - +263 78 838 3513: *2.Please elaborate on the difference between Rights and Duties and give a further explanation of the difference in Human Rights and Civil Rights.*   The difference between rights and duties is that rights are freedoms or entitlements that a person has, while duties are obligations or responsibilities that a person has. Rights are often legally protected, while duties may not be. Human rights are the basic rights and freedoms that all humans are entitled to, regardless of their nationality, race, gender, or other factors. Civil rights are the specific rights and freedoms that are guaranteed by the laws of a country, such as the right to vote, the right to due process, and the right to equal protection under the law.  Furthermore,Rights are the freedoms that a person has, while duties are the obligations that a person has. Rights are about what a person can do, while duties are about what a person must do. Rights are often seen as "positive" entitlements, while duties are seen as "negative" obligations. Rights are often seen as legally enforceable, while duties may be seen as more moral or ethical obligations. For example, the right to free speech is a legal right that is protected by law.   To elaborate further, human rights are based on the idea that all people are entitled to certain basic freedoms, such as the right to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. These rights are often enshrined in national constitutions and international treaties, such as the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Civil rights, on the other hand, are those that are specific to a particular country or region, and may not be as widely recognized. For example, the right to vote is a civil right in many countries, but it is not a human right that is recognized by all nations.  However, Rights are freedoms that a person has, while duties are obligations that a person has. The two are often intertwined, with rights giving people the freedom to do what they want, and duties giving people the responsibility to use that freedom in a way that benefits everyone. The concept of rights and duties can vary depending on the context, but they are always about balancing the needs and interests of individuals and the wider society.  To put it simply, rights and duties are two sides of the same coin. Without rights, people would not have the freedom to pursue their own interests. A prosecutor is a lawyer who works for the government, and their job is to bring criminal charges against people accused of crimes. An attorney, on the other hand, is a lawyer who can represent people in any legal matter, including both criminal and civil cases. In addition, prosecutors only represent the state, while attorneys can represent individuals, businesses, or organizations. Prosecutors also have the power to decide whether to bring charges against someone, while attorneys do not have that power.  In addition, There are several other differences between prosecutors and attorneys. Prosecutors are often salaried government employees, while attorneys can be private practitioners or work for firms. Prosecutors typically have a lot of experience with the criminal justice system, while attorneys may specialize in other areas of the law. Finally, prosecutors are usually bound by ethical rules and laws that prevent them from disclosing certain information about their cases, while attorneys are not always subject to the same restrictions.  Furthermore, some of different roles of prosecutors and attorneys, we can explore that as well. As mentioned before, prosecutors work for the government and bring criminal charges against people. They also work with law enforcement to investigate crimes, and they make decisions about whether to offer a plea deal or go to trial. Attorneys, on the other hand, can represent either the prosecution or the defense in a case. They interview witnesses, prepare evidence, and make arguments on behalf of their clients. In this way, prosecutors and attorneys have complementary but different roles in the criminal justice system.  Moreso, There are different types of attorneys. First, there are civil attorneys, who handle disputes between individuals or businesses. Then, there are criminal defense attorneys, who represent people who have been accused of a crime. There are also family law attorneys, who specialize in matters like divorce, child custody, and adoption. And there are also personal injury attorneys, who handle cases involving injuries that people have suffered. There are many more types of attorneys, but these are some of the most common.  Appart from the above , there are also some similarities between prosecutors and attorneys. For example, both types of lawyers are required to have a law degree, and both must pass a bar exam. Both types of lawyers must also adhere to ethical standards of conduct, such as confidentiality and honesty. Additionally, both prosecutors and attorneys must have strong research, writing, and communication skills. And finally, both types of lawyers must be prepared to argue their cases in court if necessary.  In conclusion, both prosecutors and attorneys play crucial roles in our legal system. Prosecutors enforce the law and hold people accountable for breaking it, while attorneys represent and advocate for their clients. While there are some similarities between the two professions, there are also many important differences. These differences reflect the different roles that prosecutors and attorneys play in our society. It's important to understand these differences in order to appreciate the complexity of our legal system.     *4.Which branch of law are you most interested in pursuing, Civil, Corporate or Criminal,* and why?   Reasons to prefer criminal law is that it can be seen as a more "pure" form of law, since it's focused on protecting the public interest. Criminal law also has a clear and well-defined structure, with clear rules and procedures. Criminal law also offers the chance to see justice served and wrongs made right. Finally, it's a challenging and engaging area of law, with plenty of opportunities for growth and development.  Criminal law has a clear and well-defined structure. There are established rules and procedures that must be followed in every case. For example, there are strict rules about what evidence can be used, and how it must be presented. There are also clear guidelines for how the prosecution and defense must behave, and what they are allowed to do. This structure ensures that everyone is treated fairly and has the same rights and protections. It also makes the process more transparent and understandable for everyone involved.  Seeing justice served is one of the most satisfying parts of working in criminal law. When someone has broken the law and caused harm, it can be very gratifying to see them held accountable and punished for their actions. This is especially true when the victim is able to see justice served, and they can feel some sense of closure and healing. Even if the criminal justice system isn't perfect, it can still be very meaningful to see it working to make things right.  Moreso,When we talk about "wrong made right" in criminal law, we're referring to the idea of "restorative justice". This is a concept that focuses on repairing the harm that has been done, rather than just punishing the offender. For example, a victim of a crime may be able to receive compensation for their losses, or the offender may be required to do community service or other forms of restitution. In this way, the wrong can be made right in a way that goes beyond simply locking someone .  Criminal law is designed to treat everyone fairly and equally, regardless of their background or status. This is known as the principle of "equality before the law". Under this principle, everyone is entitled to the same rights and protections, and they should be treated in the same way by the criminal justice system. This means that rich and poor, famous and unknown, powerful and powerless, should all be treated equally. For example, everyone has the right to a fair trial, the right to an attorney, and the right to be presumed innocent until proven guilty.  In conclusion, criminal law is an important part of the legal system, and it has many benefits. It provides a way to hold people accountable for breaking the law, it can make victims feel better by seeing justice served, and it treats everyone fairly and equally. Criminal law is an ever-evolving field, and it will continue to play a crucial role in society.     *5.What skills do you believe you have that will make you a successful lawyer, please elaborate with an example* . 118 - 22 Dec 2023 03:29PM - +263 78 126 2807: 3.What is your understanding of the OSI model? Please explain it with the layers involved.  As i have learnt and researched ,the OSI (Open Systems Interconnection) model is a conceptual framework that defines how different network protocols communicate and interact with each other. It consists of seven layers, each responsible for specific functions and tasks. Here is a brief explanation of my understanding:  1. Physical Layer: This layer deals with the physical transmission of data over the network. It defines the physical characteristics of the network, such as cables, connectors, and electrical signals.  2. Data Link Layer: The data link layer provides error-free transmission of data frames between nodes on the same network segment. It handles tasks such as framing, error detection, and flow control.  3. Network Layer: The network layer is responsible for addressing, routing, and forwarding data packets across different networks. It determines the best path for data transmission and deals with logical addressing.  4. Transport Layer: The transport layer ensures reliable and efficient data transfer between end systems. It segments data from the session layer into smaller units, manages data flow, and provides error recovery and retransmission.  5. Session Layer: The session layer establishes, manages, and terminates communication sessions between applications. It handles session synchronization, checkpointing, and recovery in case of failures.  6. Presentation Layer: The presentation layer is responsible for data formatting, encryption, compression, and conversion. It ensures that data from the application layer is properly formatted and understood by the receiving system.  7. Application Layer: The application layer is the layer closest to the end-user and provides network services directly to applications. It includes protocols for functions such as email, file transfer, remote access, and web browsing.  In conclusion the OSI model provides a standardized framework for understanding and developing network protocols. Each layer performs specific tasks and interacts with adjacent layers to enable seamless communication and data exchange across networks.
119 - 22 Dec 2023 03:36PM - +263 78 126 2807: 4. What do you understand by programming and programming languages? Which languages are most widely used in today's applications, and why?  Programming refers to the process of writing and creating computer programs or software. It involves designing, coding, testing, and maintaining instructions that tell a computer how to perform specific tasks or solve problems.  Programming languages are formal languages with a set of syntax and rules used to write computer programs. They provide a way for programmers to communicate with computers and give instructions in a format that the computer can understand and execute.  There are numerous programming languages available, each with its own strengths, weaknesses, and areas of application. Some of the most widely used programming languages in today's applications include:  1. JavaScript: JavaScript is a versatile scripting language primarily used for web development. It allows for interactive and dynamic elements on websites and is supported by all major web browsers.  2. Python: Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language known for its simplicity and readability. It is widely used in various domains, including web development, data analysis, machine learning, and scientific computing.  3. Java: Java is a popular programming language known for its platform independence. It is used for building enterprise-level applications, Android app development, and large-scale systems.  4. C#: C# (pronounced C sharp) is a programming language developed by Microsoft. It is widely used for Windows application development, game7 development, and enterprise software development on the .NET framework.  5. Swift: Swift is a programming language developed by Apple for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS app development. It is designed to be safe, efficient, and easy to learn.  The popularity of programming languages can vary depending on factors such as community support, performance, ease of use, availability of libraries and frameworks, and industry trends. The languages mentioned above have gained popularity due to their versatility, robustness, and extensive developer communities, making them suitable for a wide range of applications and platforms. <This message was edited>
120 - 22 Dec 2023 03:41PM - +263 78 126 2807: 5. What is the difference between compilers and interprete?  According to what i have researched and understood, Compilers and interpreters are both tools used in the execution of programming languages, but they differ in how they process and execute code:  1. Compiler: A compiler is a software tool that translates the entire source code of a program into machine code or a lower-level language known as object code. It performs a static analysis of the source code, checks for errors, and generates an executable file or binary that can be directly executed by the computer's hardware. The compiled code is typically optimized for performance. Examples of compiled languages include C, C++, and Java.  2. Interpreter: An interpreter, on the other hand, directly executes the source code line by line without prior translation into machine code or object code. It reads each statement, interprets it, and executes it immediately. Interpreters typically perform dynamic analysis of the code, executing it in a step-by-step manner. Examples of interpreted languages include Python, JavaScript, and Ruby.  The differences between compilers and interpreters include:  Execution: A compiler translates the entire source code before execution, producing an executable file. An interpreter executes the code directly, line by line, without generating an executable file.  Performance: Compiled code tends to have better performance as it is optimized during the compilation process. Interpreted code may have slower execution as it is interpreted line by line.  Error detection: Compilers perform a thorough analysis of the source code, detecting errors before generating the executable file. Interpreters detect errors during runtime when executing the code line by line.  Portability: Interpreted languages are generally more portable as the interpreter can be installed on different platforms. Compiled languages often require recompilation for different platforms.  Development process: Compiling can be a separate step in the development process, requiring explicit compilation before execution. Interpreted languages allow for more rapid development and debugging as changes can be immediately tested without the need for compilation.  Both compilers and interpreters have their advantages and are suitable for different scenarios depending on factors such as performance requirements, development speed, and platform compatibility. <This message was edited>

For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!  Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2000 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. Some of the most elite Schools in Zimbabawe example in Harare we are collaborated with St. Dominic‚Äôs Chishawasha, Dominican Convent, Christ Ministries and many others. In Manicaland we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. David‚Äôs Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, you would be happy to know that the DEO‚Äôs of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo we have 24 Schools collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antony‚Äôs, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke.We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not the Least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa.  Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo adds a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.  The Schools, Institutions and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized Designatories of EDOOFA in Zimbabawe. We have Mr. Shorwi Kawadza (Retd. Headmaster Hartzell), Mr. Charles Jerera (Retd. Ministry of Education), Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud students and parents community of more than 2000 from Zimbabwe who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.

23 - 22 Dec 2023 09:58AM - Gurvinder: Noted, let me brief you about the program.
24 - 22 Dec 2023 09:58AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
25 - 22 Dec 2023 09:58AM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
26 - 22 Dec 2023 09:58AM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. We are associated with more than 200 schools with more than 250 Headmaster, Chairman SDC, and Educationists that are associated with EDOOFA. *Our associate partner, Mr Shorwi Kawadza*, is a reputed Educationalist from Zimbabwe and is the Principal of Hartzell High School. *Hartzell High School*, Mutare has collaborated with us for the past Four Years from which more than 80 students have enrolled and arrived in India already. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. Similarly, the Daughter of Mr.N.M Maposa, Headmaster of Chibuwe High, the son of Ms Christina Rockson, The Principal of Hilltop Christian High School, South Africa, and the child of *Mrs. Aleta Makomeke*, DEO at Masvingo province are Edoofians and we have many more success stories from St. David's Bonda High, St. Albert‚Äôs, Christ Ministries, Advent Hope Academy, Nhowe Mission, Nyazura High, First Class High, etc.

221 - 22 Dec 2023 09:27AM - Gurvinder: Edoofa offers a guarantee of admission and scholarship to eligible students who are able to first qualify for the eligibility check. *The enrollment fee includes, assistance with creating a statement of purpose, recommendation letter, multiple university applications, and visa assistance, along with training in the Earn While You Learn Program.* This means students don't have to pay separate fees for multiple applications, SOPs, or recommendations. Edoofa is revolutionizing the admission process for international students.  Don‚Äôt you think so?
222 - 22 Dec 2023 09:29AM - +263 78 208 8260: I do think so sir
223 - 22 Dec 2023 09:29AM - Gurvinder: Since you have understood how Edoofa has made the application process simpler and affordable for the student, let me share with you the payment policy of the same for your better understanding!

225 - 22 Dec 2023 09:30AM - Gurvinder: Chido basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*

225 - 22 Dec 2023 09:30AM - Gurvinder: Chido basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*
226 - 22 Dec 2023 09:30AM - Gurvinder: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

52 - 22 Dec 2023 09:41AM - Gurvinder: Member, I wanted to discuss an exciting opportunity that a Bachelor of Arts in Geography presents, particularly regarding a career in the mining industry.  Geography plays a pivotal role in the mining sector. Understanding the earth's surface, terrain, and the distribution of resources is fundamental in mining operations. Here's why a BA in Geography could be a valuable asset for your future in mining:  Spatial Analysis: Geography offers insights into spatial analysis, which is crucial in identifying optimal locations for mining sites, assessing geological formations, and understanding terrain variations that impact mining activities.  Resource Management: Studying Geography equips you with knowledge of natural resource distribution. This includes understanding mineral deposits, water resources, and environmental factors critical for sustainable mining practices.  Environmental Impact Assessment: Mining operations often have environmental implications. A Geography background provides expertise in assessing and managing these impacts, ensuring responsible and eco-friendly mining practices.  Geospatial Technology: Geography programs often cover geospatial technologies like GIS (Geographic Information Systems) and remote sensing. These tools are extensively used in the mining industry for mapping, exploration, and monitoring purposes.  Global Perspective: Geography offers a broad understanding of global landscapes, cultures, and economic factors. This broader perspective is invaluable in navigating international mining operations and understanding diverse market landscapes.  By pursuing a BA in Geography, you'll acquire a versatile skill set that aligns perfectly with the needs of the mining industry. Your knowledge of spatial analysis, resource management, and environmental considerations will be invaluable assets in this field.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be:  d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they?  c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger.   3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble   4. Explain the phrase ‚Äògather resolution from danger‚Äô. . d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because  b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time.   SECTION 3 LANGUAGE TEST  Each passage below is accompanied by a number of questions. For some questions, you will consider how the passage might be revised to improve the expression of ideas. For other questions, you will consider how the passage might be edited to correct errors in sentence structure, usage, or punctuation. A passage or a question may be accompanied by one or more graphics (such as a table or graph) that you will consider as you make revising and editing decisions. Some questions will direct you to an underlined portion of a passage. Other questions will direct you to a location in a passage or ask you to think about the passage as a whole. Rwanda's Post-Genocide: Life 16 Years Later  Sixteen years after the genocide in Rwanda, the country has made remarkable progress in its economic and social development . Despite the devastating effects of the genocide, Rwanda has managed to achieve significant milestones in areas such as economic growth, healthcare, and foreign investments. The government's proactive measures and ambitious long-term development framework have contributed to the country's positive transformation. The resilience and determination of the Rwandan people have played a crucial role in the progress that has been made since the tragic events of 1994. This progress serves as a testament to the strength and perseverance of the nation. Today, Rwanda is viewed as politically stable, with low levels of corruption and secure conditions for foreign investments. Additionally, Rwanda has become a top performer in achieving health-related MDGs and has undergone a transformation in its healthcare system. This has resulted in improved access to healthcare services and a reduction in maternal mortality rates. Furthermore, Rwanda has seen significant economic growth and has been able to attract international investment and foreign aid. As a result, Rwanda has become one of the fastest-growing economies in the region and is on track to achieve its goal of becoming a middle-income country by 2020 . Overall, life in Rwanda 16 years after the genocide is marked by remarkable progress and hope for the future. Despite the immense challenges faced after the genocide, Rwanda has emerged as a country that has made significant strides in its economic and social development. Life in Rwanda 16 years after the genocide is marked by remarkable progress and hope for the future. In conclusion, the transformation and progress that Rwanda has experienced since the tragic events of 1994 are truly remarkable. Despite the immense challenges and devastation caused by the genocide, Rwanda has emerged as a beacon of hope and resilience. The proactive measures, ambitious development framework, and the unwavering determination of the Rwandan people have paved the way for positive change and growth in the country.  Rwanda's success in achieving health-related Millennium Development Goals, significant economic growth, and the attraction of international investment and foreign aid underscore the remarkable journey of recovery and development. As Rwanda continues its journey towards becoming a middle-income country by 2020, the nation stands as a testament to the power of determination, unity, and forward-looking vision.  The progress made by Rwanda serves as an inspiration and a testament to the transformative power of resilience and perseverance in the face of adversity. Rwanda's story embodies the potential for hope and progress in the face of unimaginable hardship, and it stands as a shining example of the human spirit's capacity for renewal and growth. 253 - 21 Dec 2023 06:49PM - +263 78 827 8861: SECTION 5 What is life in Rwanda like 16 years after the genocide there?  Over 16 years after the genocide, Rwanda's local communities remained severally affected by the experience of violence and attempts to overcome the legacy of this past represent a major challenge. Unsurprisingly, people who lived through the genocide against Tutsi and moderate Hutu, and through the 1990-94 war between the Habyarimana government and the Rwandan Patriotic Front, remember their past differently with their memories being informed by their role then and their current situation. However, the Rwandan memoryscape is not simply informed by recollection, it is also shaped by forgetting. Although at present  the deliberate eclipsing of particular memories, what I term chosen amnesia, may be essential for enabling community cohesion and facilitating the coexistence necessary for the social transformation that would render ethnicity- based violence impossible, as it prevents the social cleavages   that allowed the genocide to occur from being challenged.  Survivors and their families continue to present with considerable rates of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and substantial depressive and anxiety symptomd. The data revealed a strong association between health problems and psychological factors such as social integration. Many women suffered the consequences of rape and sexual violence. Thousands of children were orphaned and had to fend for themselves. However, Rwanda has managed to rebuild itself in the aftermath of that tragedy, setting itself apart from other developing nations  by efficiently and transparently making the most of other nations' investments and creating the building blocks of success in agriculture, social services, entrepreneurship and basic infrastructure.

In one moment things grew tough and I let my guard down, letting go of all the dreams I had. One early morning, as I was reading a book called ''THE SLIGHT EDGE'' by Jeff Olson. The words on the pages seemed to jump out at me, as if they were speaking directly to me. I could not put the book down, and when I finished reading it, I felt a sense of clarity and purpose that I had never felt before.  Jeff Olson emphasized on how everything you do everyday matter more. Therefore, the key to achieving your goal is to take simple actions. I thought and wondered on what I was passionate about and o sought to being creative and designing. I had a liking to fashion designs and I would always watch fashion shows on the television . I got fascinated about designing and I linked it with my creativeness and I wanted to be a fashion designer, as I thought to myself. I saw this as a way of opening up to new experience and perspectiveness  and the idea of allowing mistakes and embracing failure as a learning opportunity and taking risks. The moral of the story is that it is never too late  to pursue your dreams and that with perseverance

60 - 22 Dec 2023 02:00PM - +263 71 375 1398: 1.I understood that some people think and assume that a scholarship is a charitable organization which is said to be not true, one should also understand that the $10 million scholarship fund is not from a charitable organization but it is from a parent company by the name of Anhad Edutrain Solutions which was brought about in 2009  2. I understood that India is recommended for having English as the primary medium of communication and its cultural way of living And India is also recommended for its Hospitable and friendly citizens 3. I also picked on that after obtaining a scholarship you still will be having $2000 - $3000 cost and expenses per year and this is after Edoofa has found you eligible for the scholarship 4. I also understood that there is a program known as the Earn while you learn program where one is assigned to real time projects in which your efforts after completing the assignment earn you scholarship credits that help in covering part of your school fees and also the assignments live you with lifelong experiences in certain work fields 5. I also picked on that international students are not allowed to work part-time or full-time jobs as they came into the country with study visas and not work visas 6. Another aspect I understood was that of the admission process which consist of six stage namely 1.Personalized counseling sessions, 2.Eligibility check test and interview, 3. Acceptance into the Edoofa program, 4.Enrollment into the Edoofa program, admission process after the enrollment into Edoofa program and lastly 6. Admission letter and visa 7. I also understood that there are over 250+ universities in which one could get admitted into ,and all universities being government recognized 8. Another important factor I understood is that when one misses the deadlines which are very crucial their offer letters are to be revoked but that doesn't affect the eligibility of the student and that can be rectified and discussed with your counselor and the academic board  And I also picked a few wonderful remarks from the Edoofian student community where some students share their wonderful experiences with them being part of the Edoofa scholarship program.

39 - 22 Dec 2023 11:04AM - Kunal: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*

106 - 22 Dec 2023 10:36AM - Kunal: *Bsc in Optometry is a 4 year course*  Bachelor of Optometry is an undergraduate program concerning eye care. Optometry is the science of eye care including eye examination, diagnosis, treatment and management of diseases and disorders of the visual system. It is a vision care science. Bachelor of Optometry is a four-year course containing three years of learning and a year of internship in clinical experience.  It can also be defined as the science of eye equipment (including lenses and spectacles) aimed at improving the vision of the human eye. This involves removal of all kinds of obstacles of sight which an individual may suffer from. This is a dynamic and challenging career, which allows one to nurse people, achieve personal growth, community respect, job flexibility and financial stability.  The core training and practical exposure offered in the course is designed to prepare eligible candidates for providing competent services in capacities such as Optician, Optometrist, Refractionist and Ophthalmic Assistant. A graduate of this stream can serve the community in urban, semi-urban and rural settings in private, semi-governmental and governmental sectors.  Optics is the branch of science involving the structure, function, and operation of the human eye. Optometrists are health professionals who have specialized in eye care. They deal with eye testing and provide solutions to patients suffering from vision disorders such as partial sight, hereditary vision defects, squint, weakening of eye muscles etc. They suggest alternate vision aids such as spectacles or contact lenses.  They also provide preoperative and postoperative care to individual suffering from cataract. Often optometrists discover eye conditions caused by systemic problems, such as diabetes or high blood pressure, and refer their patients to other medical doctors. Since the eye is one of the most important human organs, optometrists are offered a wide range of lucrative career options both in India and abroad, assigned the responsibility of leading others from darkness to light, literally.

During the program these tests help candidates to learn and diagnose, detect and treat diseases. 151 - 22 Dec 2023 11:31AM - Kunal: Step 5: After the enrollment, we will start your Admission Process for your higher education and the Earn While You Learn(EWYL) Program by assigning your complete application to the Admission Officers and EWYL mentors , they will first prepare your Statement of Purpose and then send it to our Partner Universities. Once we receive responses from the Universities, you will be given an Offer Letter from the Universities, where your scholarship, fees, etc. would be mentioned. 51 - 22 Dec 2023 03:15PM - Kunal: *Bachelor of Business Administration or BBA* is a 3-year professional undergraduate course in Business Management. BBA course equips you with the right knowledge and skills in business and management and impart knowledge of the principles which are perfect for a career in the corporate world. A degree in Business Administration solidifies your base for your future Business and management career goals. Successful graduates of this course can opt for a range of jobs from sectors like human resource, finance, marketing, sales, management, government, and education.  Financial Analyst, Real Estate Management, Operation Management, Business Development Executive, Project Manager (IT), Data Analyst, Human Resources (HR) Manager Supply Chain Manager, Production Manager, Marketing Executive etc. are some such profiles which successful graduates interested in pursuing a job can opt for.  *What is BBA about?*  Bachelor of Business Administration is one of the most sought after bachelor degree programs aftment. The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on one‚Äôs preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  BBA degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills Bachelor of Business Administration course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. Most colleges also emphasize on a local project/ internship which is usually carried out after the fourth semester and this becomes a practical training project for the students. The final assessment for the course includes a minimum CGPA of 5.0 in all semesters, completion of the project work and lab practical.  The syllabus of the course may vary from college to college, however, the structure and topics covered, remain the same.  *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Generally, students pursue an MBA (Masters of Business Administration) course and specialize in a particular department or field of study. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. A combination of BBA and MBA is considered helpful in gaining constant promotions and high-salary job in the business world.  BBA course opens up a spectrum of job opportunities in the fields of Advertising, Academic Institutes, Banking, Consultancies, Foreign Exchange, Hotel Management, Manufacturing Industry, IT and ITES, Urban infrastructure & real estate management and various Government services. Top recruiters for BBA graduates are Accenture, Genpact, TCS, HCL Technologies, International Business Machines (IBM) Corp to name a few.  Some of the major job profiles associated with BBA degree are as follows:  *Financial Analyst* *Production Manager* *Operations Team Leader* *Business Development Executive* *Real Estate Management* *Project Manager (IT)* *Data Analyst* *Human Resources (HR) Manager* *Marketing Executive*

45 - 22 Dec 2023 02:46PM - Kunal: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5 year course which integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures.  In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues.  *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream.  *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills.  A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are:  *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations.  The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates.  *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court.  *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor.  *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job.  *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding.  A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.  *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on ‚Äì going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are:  *Good Written Communication*‚Äì Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. The written communication involves letters, documents, notices, and so on. The documents must be grammatically correct and error free. This requires a good level of English proficiency.  *Good Verbal Communication*‚Äì A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law.  *Good Time Management*‚Äì In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. The art of delegating tasks, working within deadlines, and prioritizing tasks to achieve success is very essential.  *A great degree of self-confidence*‚Äì This profession needs a high degree of self-confidence to win the clients‚Äô trust. A strong belief in yourself will go a long way in winning arguments and cases.  *An analytical mind and good research skills*‚Äì A case with proper research and well-reasoned out and evaluated argument stands a very high chance of success.  *High EQ (Emotional Quotient)*‚Äì Individuals in the legal profession, especially lawyers, must learn to be empathetic.  *Tech Savvy*‚Äì In the rapidly developing and evolving technological world, they must be abreast of the latest technology to understand and use it, as and when needed. They need to use technology to their advantage to improve their efficiency and chances of success.  *Good Commercial awareness*‚Äì This is not only restricted to being aware of the current trends and technology, prevalent in the world of business and law, but also being aware of the developments in the world of business and law, both nationally and globally.  *A high degree of patience*‚Äì This is a much needed skill, since you deal with different types of people and some cases and procedures stretch over a period of time which need a lot of patience and careful handling.  *Team player skills*‚Äì Since a legal professional will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective they need to bond with people. The art of getting work done and obtaining information though networking and working with people helps in attaining the objectives.

It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative. *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on ‚Äì going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are: *Good Written Communication*‚Äì Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. The written communication involves letters, documents, notices, and so on. The documents must be grammatically correct and error free. This requires a good level of English proficiency. *Good Verbal Communication*‚Äì A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law. *Good Time Management*‚Äì In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. The art of delegating tasks, working within deadlines, and prioritizing tasks to achieve success is very essential. *A great degree of self-confidence*‚Äì This profession needs a high degree of self-confidence to win the clients‚Äô trust. A strong belief in yourself will go a long way in winning arguments and cases. *An analytical mind and good research skills*‚Äì A case with proper research and well-reasoned out and evaluated argument stands a very high chance of success. *High EQ (Emotional Quotient)*‚Äì Individuals in the legal profession, especially lawyers, must learn to be empathetic. *Tech Savvy*‚Äì In the rapidly developing and evolving technological world, they must be abreast of the latest technology to understand and use it, as and when needed. They need to use technology to their advantage to improve their efficiency and chances of success. *Good Commercial awareness*‚Äì This is not only restricted to being aware of the current trends and technology, prevalent in the world of business and law, but also being aware of the developments in the world of business and law, both nationally and globally. *A high degree of patience*‚Äì This is a much needed skill, since you deal with different types of people and some cases and procedures stretch over a period of time which need a lot of patience and careful handling. *Team player skills*‚Äì Since a legal professional will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective they need to bond with people. The art of getting work done and obtaining information though networking and working with people helps in attaining the objectives.

403 - 22 Dec 2023 03:38PM - Sahil Edoofa: Okay so basically you see in the first mode, the Direct Bank Transfer Mode, the transfer charges which are to be borne by the parents of the student ranges between $100 to $120 which become quite high for a lot of parents considering the economic situation in Zimbabwe itself. So as not every student is in a position to cater for an additional $100 to $120 just as transfer charge, the second mode was introduced, wherein, it is the Bank deposit in Mr. Charles's Account, in this the transfer charges get divided amongst 10 students resulting in an equivalent bearing of 12.5% at the end.  So as you can see in the letter that there is a Bank deposit in, Mr. Charles Jerera (Retired Education Officer)'s account as he is our Associated Partner there in Zimbabwe, Since 2020 there have been over 1400+ students who have been assisted by Mr Charles inorder to complete their enrollment formalities as well as university fee payments after arriving in India.
404 - 22 Dec 2023 03:38PM - Sahil Edoofa: Therefore the fee can also be paid through him. Since his account is a NOSTRO Account which only holds USD itself, therefore the necessary amount including the transfer charges in this mode itself would be $394 ($350 + $44 transfer charges), and the same details are as below:-  BANK NAME: FBC  SWIFT CODE: FBCPZWHA  ACC NAME: CHARLES JERERA  ACC NUMBER: 5333 0380 1404 8828  CONTACT NUMBER: +263 77 376 9854

Opting for early enrollment brings forth several noteworthy advantages:  Exclusive Access to Scholarships: Edoofa scholarships are in high demand, and early enrollment ensures that your child has exclusive access to the financial support offered by our scholarship program.  Seat Assurance: Early enrollment guarantees your child a confirmed seat in the program, eliminating any potential competition for seats as the intake date approaches. This proactive approach ensures a smooth and stress-free admission process.  Ample Time for Preparation: The one and a half years leading up to the August 2025 intake provide a generous timeframe for meticulous preparation. This spans document verification, visa processing, and any academic preparations needed, contributing to a seamless transition.  Strategic Financial Planning: Enrolling early facilitates strategic financial planning. You gain the flexibility to explore various funding options, including the Earn While You Learn (EWYL) program, enabling you to establish a robust and stable financial plan for your child's education.  Fee Consistency Guarantee: Early enrollment secures the current fees, offering a consistent and predictable cost structure throughout the course. This shields against potential fee increases in the future.  Furthermore, admission for the August 2025 Intake opens up an opportune period for your child to make the most of this time:  Early Engagement in EWYL Program: A head start of over 20 months provides your child with a distinct advantage in the EWYL program. This time allows for a comprehensive understanding of projects and assignments, enabling the earning of scholarship credits even before arriving in India.(For example even if your child earns $100 a month he or she can self finance entire before even coming to India like many student often do let me share video of one such student )  Effective Communication with Admissions Team: Parents can proactively engage with the Admissions Team, focusing on financial planning and addressing any potential challenges. This proactive approach ensures a well-prepared international education journey for your child.  Community Integration: Becoming part of the Edoofa community early on allows students to connect with high achievers and toppers in their respective fields. This interaction proves invaluable for academic queries, potentially reducing the need for additional tuitions hence saving your cost for tutors.  Considering these factors, early enrollment not only secures the scholarship but also provides a substantial timeframe for thorough preparation and strategic planning.

342 - 22 Dec 2023 02:32PM - Sahil Edoofa: Okay so basically you see in the first mode, the Direct Bank Transfer Mode, the transfer charges which are to be borne by the parents of the student ranges between $100 to $120 which become quite high for a lot of parents considering the economic situation in Zimbabwe itself. So as not every student is in a position to cater for an additional $100 to $120 just as transfer charge, the second mode was introduced, wherein, it is the Bank deposit in Mr. Charles's Account, in this the transfer charges get divided amongst 10 students resulting in an equivalent bearing of 12.5% at the end.  So as you can see in the letter that there is a Bank deposit in, Mr. Charles Jerera (Retired Education Officer)'s account as he is our Associated Partner there in Zimbabwe, Since 2020 there have been over 1400+ students who have been assisted by Mr Charles inorder to complete their enrollment formalities as well as university fee payments after arriving in India.

263 - 22 Dec 2023 02:35PM - Sahil Edoofa: I understand what you are sharing, basically, my motive behind asking such a question was the fact that, as a counsellor, I have helped tens of thousands of students in the last 5 and a half years in Zimbabwe, and I do understand that financial stability in an economy like Zimbabwe is quite difficult these days. This is why I want to ask you if your child manages to pass the eligibility check stage, then you would have to complete payment of $350 towards the enrollment fee.  I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.
264 - 22 Dec 2023 02:35PM - Sahil Edoofa: Since Edoofa has been in existence for over 6 years in Africa and 14+ years as a Scholarship Program, It predominantly boasts a student community of 1500+ students. There have been instances where Students have applied to the program to see what happens next and their inquisitiveness without proper financial preparations and discussions with the family has led to consequences that are not a positive remark to the student's profile for tertiary education. The following were taken as remedial and disciplinary action by the board:-  1. The application was revoked and the student's scholarship seat was awarded to another student who as of the moment would be on the waiting list.  2. On the application of the student, disciplinary action was taken due to which the student gets barred for Three years from Edoofa Scholarship Program.  Or  A fee of $500 or the Program Fees from that round of admission, whichever is higher as applicable.
265 - 22 Dec 2023 02:35PM - Sahil Edoofa: Edoofa carries a repute because of the foster and cares it has provided to all students who are studying under the Program because of this the program has been recognized by various, government bodies, including the First Lady of Zimbabwe, the Ministry of Education and Zimbabwean High Commission in India  I will be attaching the pictures of our founder's meetings with them below.

473 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: Early financial planning for tertiary education is crucial for parents for several reasons:  *Cost of Education:* Tertiary education, including college or university, can be expensive. Tuition fees, books, accommodation, and other associated costs can add up significantly. Planning allows parents to save and budget for these expenses, reducing the financial burden when the time comes.
474 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Time Horizon:* Tertiary education typically takes several years to complete. By starting to save early, parents have a longer time horizon to accumulate the necessary funds.
475 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Financial Stability:* By planning early, parents can avoid financial stress and debt. Without proper planning, they may have to rely on loans or other high-cost financing options, which can lead to long-term financial challenges. SAVE YOURSELF FROM LOANS  *INTERNSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK:* Early planning can also involve students participating in projects that will be offered by the EWYL Department of Edoofa after Induction which can help offset the cost of education. These opportunities often have application deadlines, so planning allows parents to take advantage of them.  *Teach Financial Responsibility:* Involving children in the financial planning process can teach them valuable lessons about money management, savings, and responsibility. It helps instill good financial habits from an early age.
476 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Avoiding Last-Minute Rush:* Delaying financial planning until the last minute can lead to rushed decisions and inadequate savings. Early planning provides a more thoughtful and organized approach.  *Goal Setting:* Setting specific financial goals for education allows parents to track their progress and adjust their savings strategies as needed. It provides a clear roadmap for achieving the desired educational outcomes.
477 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Peace of Mind:* Knowing that you have a financial plan in place for your child's education can provide peace of mind. It reduces uncertainty and allows parents to focus on other aspects of their child's development without constant worry about funding education.
477 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Peace of Mind:* Knowing that you have a financial plan in place for your child's education can provide peace of mind. It reduces uncertainty and allows parents to focus on other aspects of their child's development without constant worry about funding education.
478 - 22 Dec 2023 01:17PM - Shubham Madhwal: In conclusion, early financial planning for tertiary education is essential for parents to ensure that they can provide their children with quality education without compromising their own financial stability. 185 - 22 Dec 2023 04:34PM - Shubham Madhwal: *In India, the average cost of Higher Education for international students is around $6000-$8000 per year*. Now while this is very low as compared to other western education hubs such as the US, UK, Canada, Germany, etc, it is still beyond the reach of many. So EDOOFA works with universities to secure seats on scholarships for its students so that their cost of education is reduced greatly.
186 - 22 Dec 2023 04:34PM - Shubham Madhwal: *But, for the selected students who are able to qualify for the EDOOFA Program by undergoing various tests, the cost comes down to $2000-$3000 per year*. This cost includes:  1. Remaining Tuition fees (if any) 2. Basic University Expenses (Library, etc.) 3. Food 4. Accommodation
187 - 22 Dec 2023 04:34PM - Shubham Madhwal: *To understand it better, the cost of $2000 to $3000 per year which includes the remaining cost of tuition fees, food and accommodation expenses will have to be paid semester-wise (2 semesters in a year) after the student arrives at the University.*

249 - 22 Dec 2023 12:00PM - Shubham Madhwal: Please *The enrollment fee is charged to you for*:  1. Edoofa provides foster care to all its students. We offer a comprehensive training program on Employability Skills for the entire course. The Earn While You Learn Program, is a department where the child learns skills and also gets an opportunity to earn $50-$100 per month.  3. The guaranteed 50-100% Scholarship we offer to our students.
253 - 22 Dec 2023 12:20PM - Shubham Madhwal: Basically, there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.
254 - 22 Dec 2023 12:20PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee, before their Grade 12 result is out).
255 - 22 Dec 2023 12:20PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Phase 3:* Once the final grade 12 results are out, if the student would have passed the necessary requirement (of 4 Grade 12 passes.) then start with their University Interaction. If the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.   *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
256 - 22 Dec 2023 12:20PM - Shubham Madhwal: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can *complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.*

After that, we will connect you with the universities to clear all your doubts and also if the university has any questions for you.  We have experience working with over 250+ universities and with that experience, you will have a proper admission expert assisting you with your admission.
